tool_description: Constructs program logic models showing the relationships between inputs, activities, outputs, outcomes, and impacts.

planned_activities.description: Specific activities the program will implement

target_population.description: Primary population the program aims to serve

available_inputs.description: Resources, staff, and materials available for the program

outcome_timeframes.description: Expected timeframes for different outcome levels

external_factors.description: External factors that may influence program success

evaluation_focus.description: Primary evaluation focus: process, outcome, or impact

error_messages: Insufficient program components: Provide at least one goal, activity, and input.
Too many activities: Limit planned activities to 15 or fewer for manageable logic model.
Missing target population: Specify who the program is designed to serve.
Invalid evaluation focus: Use one of [process, outcome, impact].
Excessive inputs: Limit available inputs to 20 or fewer items for clarity.
usage: Input program goals, planned activities, target population, and available inputs. Optionally specify outcome timeframes and external factors. Tool creates comprehensive logic model showing program theory.

inputs.description: Resources and materials needed for program implementation

outputs.description: Direct products or deliverables from program activities

assumptions.description: Key assumptions underlying the program logic
